intro: Dracaena princeps, commonly known as the Madagascar dragon tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-like arrangement of dark green, strap-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, which later develop into red, fleshy fruits. Dracaena princeps is adapted to arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardening.
